required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Warm Packs, Perineal Massage and Hands Off During Labour in the Perineal Outcomes.
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Warm Packs, Perineal Massage and Hands Off During Labour in the Perineal Outcomes.

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effectiveness of warm packs, perineal massage and hands off, during labour, in the perineal outcomes. The perineal outcomes are perineal tears, grade of perineal tears, need of suture, perineal edema, perineal pain, use of drugs for perineal pain, and satisfaction with the technique used.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomised controled trial.

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with perineal tear after vaginal delivery requiring suture (evaluated as yes or no).

secondary_outcome.description: Perineal edema is scored 0-4 (0 = no edema; 4 = edema invades the perineal body) .
self reported ´perineal pain intensity. Perineal pain is scored 0-10 (0 = no pain; 10 = pain as bad as can be).

secondary_outcome.measure: Use of drugs for perineal pain
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants using drugs for perineal pain at the time of 24 hours after vaginal delivery (evaluated as yes or no).
Satisfaction of the woman with the technique used for perineal care. Satisfaction is scored 0-4 (0 = very satisfied; 4 = very dissatisfied)
Number of participants with perineal tear after vaginal delivery (evaluated as yes or no).

arm_group.description: The warm packs are held in the mother's perineum during birth. The warm packs are changed as needed to maintain warmth.
The perineal massage will be gently held in the longitudinal direction of the muscle fibers, with movements of the thumb and forefinger, like "count coins".
Hands off group does not receive any perineal manipulation and they are only observed.

intervention.description: : The warm packs are held in the mother's perineum during birth. The warm packs are changed as needed to maintain warmth.
The perineal massage will be gently held in the longitudinal direction of the muscle fibers, with movements of the thumb and forefinger, like "count coins".

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- parturient in active phase of labour
- single fetus at term (37-42 weeks)
- bent cephalic fetal presentation
- parity less than four children
Exclusion Criteria:
- use any perineal preparation techniques during pregnancy
- clinical indication for caesarean section
